column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0003]Timely intelligence is critical to proper business decision making.
#Text=Collecting and quickly analyzing information, however, is often difficult.
#Text=In a dynamic marketplace, delayed delivery of intelligence can reduce both its reliability and relevancy.
#Text=Substantial delays can even make the information, often acquired at considerable cost, completely worthless.
#Text=[0004]Intelligence is often extracted from OLTP applications and from specialized databases, called operational data stores.
#Text=OLTP (online transaction processing) applications are those enterprise systems that manage a company's basic transactions, such as order entry and billing systems.
#Text=Since they are commonly optimized for reading and writing, and not for querying, extracting information from an OLTP application can be sufficiently complex to require additional user training.
#Text=Furthermore, while operational data stores generally archive OLTP information in a format for querying, they also generally do not maintain important historical information.
#Text=For instance, an operational data store may store a current checking account balance, but not the individual daily balances over the previous month.
#Text=[0005]In addition, the queries themselves often take substantial time to execute, producing only static snapshots of the information.
#Text=Observing the dynamic aspect of changing information is therefore difficult.
#Text=A possible solution may be to sequentially execute and aggregate a series of queries.
#Text=However, this solution can be both inefficient and ineffective, since manual manipulation still often delays the information delivery.
#Text=That is, these queries must be first manually aggregated and summarized, before intelligence reports can be generated and delivered.
#Text=[0006]ETL (extraction, transformation, and loading) systems help by extracting, transforming, and aggregating the information.

#Text=But latency inherently found in most distributed networks, coupled with considerable manual intervention that ETL systems often require, mean that critical information can still be received late.
#Text=[0007]Automatic notification is a possible solution.
#Text=Many analytical products such as business intelligence (BI) and online analytical processing (OLAP) systems are capable of monitoring, scheduling, and broadcasting alerts via email or pager.
#Text=These systems, however, cannot generally assure that the intended recipient promptly receives and reads the message.
#Text=This presents a significant problem for time-sensitive information, where minutes or even seconds can make a difference.
